title: Function Concepts-Graphical and Analytical: Exponential, Part C

content.description: The figure shows the graph of the function <math alttext="f" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>f</mi></math> on its domain of all real numbers <math alttext="negative 3.5 less or equal than x less or equal than 3.5" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mo>-</mo> <mn>3.5</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>3.5</mn> </math>. The points <math alttext="open parentheses negative 3 comma 1 close parentheses" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, <math alttext="open parentheses 0 comma 1 close parentheses" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, and <math alttext="open parentheses 3 comma 1 close parentheses" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> are on the graph of <math alttext="f" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>f</mi></math>. The function <math alttext="g" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>g</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses 2.916 close parentheses times open parentheses 0.7 close parentheses to the power of x" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2.916</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mfenced><mn>0.7</mn></mfenced><mi>x</mi></msup></math>.
content.question:
Part C

(i) ​​​​Determine if <math alttext="f"> <mi>f</mi> </math> has an inverse function.

(ii) Give a reason for your answer based on the definition of a function and the graph of <math alttext="y equals f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>.

frqParts.text:
Part C

(i) ​​​​Determine if <math alttext="f"> <mi>f</mi> </math> has an inverse function.

(ii) Give a reason for your answer based on the definition of a function and the graph of <math alttext="y equals f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
